comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)

The world map is in an svg node that is clipped via overflow='hidden' to the small box BELOW the "Pick Locations" gray bar.  Note that this node is drawn after the gray bar.  When the map overflows the gray bar, clicking on the bar appears to activate the map mousedown event handler even though the map was 'hidden' and not drawn over the bar.  The bar itself disappears and the map shows through.  This does not happen in Chrome/Opera/Safari.

Now, one can say click on the small inset world map on Alaska.  This moves the big map down so that it shows Alaska.  In this position, it no longer overflows onto the gray bar.  Now if I click on the gray bar, nothing happens which is what is suppose to happen.  This indicates to me that while Firefox correctly DREW the map and clipped it, it did not CLIP the mousedown event sensing area.  This is my guess at the issue.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.See details.  Clicking on title bar "Pick Locations" activates map mousedown event handler, causing map to bleed through bar.
2.
3.
Actual Results:  
See above.

Expected Results:  
Try it in Chrome/Safari/Opera.

This app is complex.  I believe this is a bug in Firefox since it works in Opera, Chrome, Safari, and IE 7/8 w/Adobe SVG.
